definitions.definition: ( ambitransitive ) To give money or other compensation to in exchange for goods or services.
examples: How much will the job pay ?
he paid him to clean the place up
he paid her off the books and in kind where possible

definitions.definition: ( ambitransitive ) To discharge, as a debt or other obligation, by giving or doing what is due or required.
examples: she offered to pay the bill
he has paid his debt to society
It didn't pay him to keep the store open any more.

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To give (something else than money).
( intransitive ) To be profitable or worth the effort.
( intransitive ) To discharge an obligation or debt.
examples: He was allowed to go as soon as he paid .
He paid for his fun in the sun with a terrible sunburn.

definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To admit that a joke, punchline, etc., was funny .

main_definition: ( ambitransitive ) To give money or other compensation to in exchange for goods or services.
secondary_definitions: ( ambitransitive ) To discharge, as a debt or other obligation, by giving or doing what is due or required.
( transitive ) To give (something else than money).
( intransitive ) To be profitable or worth the effort.
( intransitive ) To discharge an obligation or debt.
( transitive ) To admit that a joke, punchline, etc., was funny .

definitions.definition: To cover (the bottom of a vessel, a seam, a spar, etc.) with tar or pitch , or a waterproof composition of tallow , resin , etc.; to smear .

main_definition: ( nautical , transitive ) To cover (the bottom of a vessel, a seam, a spar, etc.) with tar or pitch , or a waterproof composition of tallow , resin , etc.; to smear .
